forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
The good news :wink: are that you appear like being a very honest person ![:hi:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/hi.gif) : > typical arrogant american since you just posted your question on a topic where in the title it says: > Index of USB Boot Making Applications, **Please DO NOT post here**, post in the above Now, that's arrogant! ![:dubbio:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dubbio.gif) The bad news :wink: is that you are not fully honest, your question is not "Almost", buut rather "Completely and utterly" off-topic! :tongue: However, it is simply NOT possible to have a "script" written in notepad that did what you are talking about. For two good reasons: * Whatever you write in Notepad or in ANY "RAW text" editor comes out as "*RAW text"* :wink:, it may represent a script, but there is no way in the world that you can say it is written in Notepad (as opposed to ANY other "RAW text" editor - and there are tens if not hundreds of them available * There is NO way a "script" of ANY kind can do what you are talking about
The known alternative to "flipping the removable bit" through the use of the Lexar utility you mention or ANY other "Manufacturer Production tool" suitable for the particular controller of the given stick is the use of a "filter driver". There are two of them widely known: * cfadisk.sys aka Hitachi Microdrive Filter Driver * dummydisk.sys by Anton Bassov
Just google for the above keywords and you will find here on boot-land and on MSFN and 911CD boards related threads and howto's about installing and setting them. An Admin or Mod may want to move your post and my reply to it somewhere more suitable (like a new thread meaningfully titled). :tongue: Wonko

forumNotes.author: COD11
forumNotes.content:
**How to use the "Hitachi Microdrive Filter Driver " for USB Flash Drive (UFD) partitioning**  

1. Download Driver Package from [here](http://www.uwe-sieber.de/files/xpfildrvr1224_320.zip "External link").  

2. Extract **cfadisk.inf** and **cfadisk.sys** to a folder on your UFD (1st primary partition automatically). Just to have it available, when you need it on other systems !  

3. Open **cfadisk.inf** with an Editor.  

4. Look for lines ...  

```
...

[cfadisk_device]

%Microdrive_devdesc% = cfadisk_install,...

%Microdrive_devdesc% = cfadisk_install,...

...

[cfadisk_addreg]

...
```

... and **replace** it by  

```
...

[cfadisk_device]

%Microdrive_devdesc% = cfadisk_install,USBSTOR\GenDisk



[cfadisk_addreg]

...
```

Leave only this (ONE) line under the item **cfadisk_device** , delete the rest up to the empty line preceeding **cfadisk_addreg** (both excluded, of course). There is no need to alter anything else.  

5. In Windows start "Device Management" (devmgmt.msc), open "Disks", right click your UFD and "actualize" the driver. It's not found automatically; you have to point the wizard to your UFD (where it should be according to item 2). When you see "Hitachi Microdrive" as selection, choose it and proceed. Ignore the usual warning.  

6. There is no need to reboot. Just go to "Disk management" (diskmgmt.msc) and  
partition your UFD for your needs.
